repnme.cdata!:
Thailand - Clean Fuels and Environmental
            Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory, with
            a likely sustainability. This experience reinforces once
            again, the importance of competent skills mix among the
            project implementation team, and consultants, able of
            handling risk management; the essential need for borrower
            ownership; and, that strong supervision leads to success.
            Nonetheless, specific lessons suggest that it should be
            reasonably expected that Bank staff face the responsibility
            of explaining the facts, or any changes to the Borrower in
            the interest of better implementation, for had the Bank not
            overlooked the fact that certain procurement guidelines had
            been changed, procurement delays could have been avoided.
            Moreover, it would be advantageous that the Bank considers
            the track record - both managerial and financial - of civil
            works contractors in the country as a pre-qualification
            criterion, particularly in cases of fast track operations
            such as this one, where usually little flexibility exists,
            though timing remains a critical factor in the development
            of civil works.

18225911.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
18225911.theme: Pollution management and environmental health,Environmental policies and institutions,Climate change

repnme.cdata!:
Thailand - Clean Fuels and Environmental
            Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the Clean Fuels
            and Environmental Improvement Project is to support the
            reduction of air pollutants attributable to petroleum fuels
            in Thailand. The project comprises the following components:
            1) a deep gas oil hydrotreater (DGOHT) of 30,000 barrels
            stream per day (bpsd) capacity to enable the production of
            0.05 weight percent sulfur diesel oil; 2) a fluid catalytic
            cracker (FCC) of 16,000 bpsd capacity and modifications to
            existing naphtha reformer to produce high octane, low
            aromatic and low benzene content gasoline, in order to
            enable the refinery's gasoline pool to meet unleaded
            octane requirements, and permissible aromatics and benzene
            and other prescribed specifications; 3) the installation of
            equipment and facilities to further enhance the
            refinery's environmental mitigation system and safety;
            4) the purchase of modern air quality monitoring equipment;
            5) project engineering and management; 6) acquisition of
            technology and procurement of catalysts and chemicals; and
            7) training.

repnme.cdata!:
Thailand - Environmental Improvement and
            Clean Fuels Project : environmental assessment report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Environmental Improvement and Clean
            Fuels Project will provide additional refinery facilities
            required to meet Thailand's new clean fuel standards
            prior to the year 2000 in addition to upgrading safety and
            environmental operations.  The project scope is to add a
            Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) unit for improving gasoline
            product quality, a deep gas oil hydrodesulfurization unit
            for improving diesel product quality and associated
            facilities including environmental controls.  This
            assessment reviews the following areas of impact: 1) air
            emissions control; 2) water quality; 3) planned expansion to
            the wastewater treatment system; 4) impact on land use; 5)
            impacts on transportation; 6) impacts on community; and 7)
            occupational health and safety.  The assessment also
            includes a review of industrial hazards and recommendations
            for environmental management and training.

docna.cdata!:
Thailand - Environmental Improvement and
            Clean Fuels Project : environmental assessment report
